dependencies.description: Autoconf -- system configuration part of autotools
dependencies.name: autoconf

dependencies.description: Automake -- make file builder part of autotools
dependencies.name: automake

dependencies.description:
The NVIDIA HPC SDK is a comprehensive suite of compilers, libraries and
tools essential to maximizing developer productivity and the performance
and portability of HPC applications. The NVIDIA HPC SDK C, C++, and
Fortran compilers support GPU acceleration of HPC modeling and
simulation applications with standard C++ and Fortran, OpenACC
directives, and CUDA. GPU-accelerated math libraries maximize
performance on common HPC algorithms, and optimized communications
libraries enable standards-based multi-GPU and scalable systems
programming. Performance profiling and debugging tools simplify porting
and optimization of HPC applications.
dependencies.name: c

dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
The GNU config.guess and config.sub scripts versioned by timestamp.
This package can be used as a build dependency for autotools packages
that ship a tarball with outdated config.guess and config.sub files.
dependencies.name: gnuconfig

dependencies.description: libtool -- library building part of autotools.
dependencies.name: libtool

dependencies.description: GNU M4 is an implementation of the traditional Unix macro processor.
dependencies.name: m4

dependent_to.description:
AML is a memory management library designed to ease the use of complex
memory topologies and complex data layout optimizations for high-
performance computing applications.
dependent_to.name: aml

dependent_to.description: a pArallel Server for Adaptive GeoInformation.
dependent_to.name: asagi

dependent_to.description:
DPDK is a set of libraries and drivers for fast packet processing. It
supports many processor architectures and both FreeBSD and Linux.
dependent_to.name: dpdk

dependent_to.description: Elbencho storage benchmark
dependent_to.name: elbencho

dependent_to.description:
Extrae is the package devoted to generate tracefiles which can be
analyzed later by Paraver. Extrae is a tool that uses different
interposition mechanisms to inject probes into the target application so
as to gather information regarding the application performance. The
Extrae instrumentation package can instrument the MPI programin model,
and the following parallel programming models either alone or in
conjunction with MPI : OpenMP, CUDA, OpenCL, pthread, OmpSs
dependent_to.name: extrae

dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) Runtime is designed to
enhance energy efficiency of applications through active hardware
configuration.
dependent_to.name: geopm-runtime

dependent_to.description:
High-performance linear algebra library for manycore systems, with a
focus on sparse solution of linear systems.
dependent_to.name: ginkgo

dependent_to.description:
HIP is a C++ Runtime API and Kernel Language that allows developers to
create portable applications for AMD and NVIDIA GPUs from single source
code.
dependent_to.name: hip

dependent_to.description:
Hip-ROCclr is a virtual device interface that compute runtimes interact
with to different backends such as ROCr or PAL This abstraction allows
runtimes to work on Windows as well as on Linux without much effort.
dependent_to.name: hip-rocclr

dependent_to.description: HIPCC: HIP compiler driver
dependent_to.name: hipcc

dependent_to.description:
This repository includes the user mode API nterfaces and libraries
necessary for host applications to launch computer kernels to available
HSA ROCm kernel agents.AMD Heterogeneous System Architecture HSA - Linux
HSA Runtime for Boltzmann (ROCm) platforms.
dependent_to.name: hsa-rocr-dev

dependent_to.description:
This is a thunk python recipe to build and install Thunk Interface.
Thunk Interface is a user-mode API interfaces used to interact with the
ROCk driver.
dependent_to.name: hsakmt-roct

dependent_to.description:
The Hardware Locality (hwloc) software project. The Portable Hardware
Locality (hwloc) software package provides a portable abstraction
(across OS, versions, architectures, ...) of the hierarchical topology
of modern architectures, including NUMA memory nodes, sockets, shared
caches, cores and simultaneous multithreading. It also gathers various
system attributes such as cache and memory information as well as the
locality of I/O devices such as network interfaces, InfiniBand HCAs or
GPUs. It primarily aims at helping applications with gathering
information about modern computing hardware so as to exploit it
accordingly and efficiently.
dependent_to.name: hwloc

dependent_to.description:
Kokkos implements a programming model in C++ for writing performance
portable applications targeting all major HPC platforms.
dependent_to.name: kokkos

dependent_to.description:
The CXI library provides interfaces which interact directly with CXI
drivers.
dependent_to.name: libcxi

dependent_to.description:
The Open Fabrics Interfaces (OFI) is a framework focused on exporting
fabric communication services to applications.
dependent_to.name: libfabric

dependent_to.description: PSM3 provider for the PSM3 OFI provider
dependent_to.name: libpsm3

dependent_to.description: The Linux perf tool.
dependent_to.name: linux-perf

dependent_to.description:
The memkind library is a user extensible heap manager built on top of
jemalloc which enables control of memory characteristics and a
partitioning of the heap between kinds of memory. The kinds of memory
are defined by operating system memory policies that have been applied
to virtual address ranges. Memory characteristics supported by memkind
without user extension include control of NUMA and page size features.
The jemalloc non-standard interface has been extended to enable
specialized arenas to make requests for virtual memory from the
operating system through the memkind partition interface. Through the
other memkind interfaces the user can control and extend memory
partition features and allocate memory while selecting enabled features.
dependent_to.name: memkind

dependent_to.description:
NumaMMa is a lightweight memory profiler that reports the memory access
patterns of applications.
dependent_to.name: numamma

dependent_to.description:
NumaProf is a NUMA memory access profiling tool. It is based on Intel-
PIN to intercept all the memory access and report them on NUMA counters
so we can tell by annotating the source code where you make local,
remote, unpinned memory accessed. It also provide some charts to better
understand the NUMA behavior of the application.
dependent_to.name: numaprof

dependent_to.description:
OmpSs-2 is a data-flow shared-memory programming model based on source
annotations. It is developed by the Barcelona Supercomputing Center as a
successor to the StarSs and OmpSs programming models.
dependent_to.name: ompss-2

dependent_to.description: Omni-Path Performance Scaled Messaging 2 (PSM2) library
dependent_to.name: opa-psm2

dependent_to.description:
An open source Message Passing Interface implementation. The Open MPI
Project is an open source Message Passing Interface implementation that
is developed and maintained by a consortium of academic, research, and
industry partners. Open MPI is therefore able to combine the expertise,
technologies, and resources from all across the High Performance
Computing community in order to build the best MPI library available.
Open MPI offers advantages for system and software vendors, application
developers and computer science researchers.
dependent_to.name: openmpi

dependent_to.description:
A command-line tool that displays as much detail about itself and its
environment as possible. It can be used as a test tool, to understand
the type of environment a process runs in, and for comparing system
environments.
dependent_to.name: procenv

dependent_to.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependent_to.name: py-torch

dependent_to.description:
RCCL (pronounced "Rickle") is a stand-alone library of standard
collective communication routines for GPUs, implementing all-reduce,
all-gather, reduce, broadcast, and reduce-scatter.
dependent_to.name: rccl

dependent_to.description: OpenCL: Open Computing Language on ROCclr
dependent_to.name: rocm-opencl

dependent_to.description: OpenMP support for ROCm LLVM.
dependent_to.name: rocm-openmp-extras

dependent_to.description: Radeon Open Compute Parallel Primitives Library
dependent_to.name: rocprim

dependent_to.description: ROCPROFILER library for AMD HSA runtime API extension support
dependent_to.name: rocprofiler-dev

dependent_to.description: SICM: Simplified Interface to Complex Memory.
dependent_to.name: sicm

dependent_to.description:
The Storage Performance Development Kit (SPDK) provides a set of tools
and libraries for writing high performance, scalable, user-mode storage
applications. It achieves high performance by moving all of the
necessary drivers into userspace and operating in a polled mode instead
of relying on interrupts, which avoids kernel context switches and
eliminates interrupt handling overhead.
dependent_to.name: spdk

dependent_to.description:
A library for capturing hardware topology and attributes of compute
systems.
dependent_to.name: sys-sage

dependent_to.description:
TransferBench is a utility capable of benchmarking simultaneous copies
between user-specified devices (CPUs/GPUs)
dependent_to.name: transferbench

dependent_to.description:
a communication library implementing high-performance messaging for
MPI/PGAS frameworks
dependent_to.name: ucx

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
